p: Among the 13 marten samples, 40%, 33% and 27% of all sequences were attributed to plant, invertebrate and vertebrate diet components, respectively (note that blocking primers for Martes where not employed, which most likely affected detection efficiency of vertebrates). We found an average of 6 sequences per sample, although with large variation (i.e. 2 samples with 12 and 13 sequences, and a few samples with only 2 sequences). Overall, 35% of those sequences were identified to species level, 26% to genus, 24% to family, and finally, 6% to order, and 9% to higher taxonomic levels (Supplementary Table 4).
